text.p: Graphix Zone Thursday said it is expanding into the games business with the acquisition of Inscape, a partnership between Time Warner Inc's HBO and Warner Music Group and Nash New Media.

In a statement, Graphix Zone said Inscape, best known for role-playing games such as The Residents' Bad Day on the Midway and The Dark Eye, will become the company's game division and its premier game imprint.
Under terms of the deal, Time Warner will receive a minority stake in Graphix Zone.

Graphix Zone intends to focus on three growing markets: games, entertainment and Internet products. Game titles will be developed and distributed under the Inscape banner, while interactive music, branded entertainment and Internet products will continue to be sold under the Graphix Zone label.
Graphix Zone intends to release 12 - 16 titles in 1997, building the slate with assets acquired from Inscape and individual developers.
